questions.question: A surgeon is to perform a mastoidectomy procedure for a patient with CSOM. He uses the following instrument during the procedure. What is the name of the given instrument?
questions.explanation: The above image shows Mollison's mastoid retractor. It is used in mastoidectomy procedures to retract soft tissues after incision and elevation of flaps. It is self-retaining and hemostatic. Shown below is Jansen's self-retaining mastoid retractor. Jansen's self-retaining mastoid retractor

questions.question: The following instrument is used for:OMARROW566
questions.explanation: The given instrument with an arrowed blade and angled shank is a myringotome. It is used formyringotomy.

questions.question: A 25-year-old patient is to undergo mastoid surgery. Which of the following instruments will not be present in the operation theatre?
questions.explanation: Lempert's trocar does not exist. Option A: Lempert's curette (scoop) is used for removal of bony septa and granulations in mastoid surgery. Lempert's curette is used for this purpose. Option B: Lempert's endaural retractor is used for endaural approach to ear surgery. It has two lateral blades which retract the flaps and a third central blade with holes. The central blade retracts the temporalis muscle. The central blade can be fixed to the body of the retractor by its hole. Lempert's endaural retractor is used in this manner. Option C: Lempert's endaural speculum is used to spread open the meatus when giving the local injection or making an endaural incision. Lempert's endaural speculum is utilized for this purpose. Lempert's incision is used in endaural approach. It consists of two parts: Lempert I: It is a semicircular incision, made from 12 o'clock to 6 o'clock position in the posterior meatal wall at the bony-cartilaginous junction. Lempert II: Starts from the first incision at 12 o'clock and then passes upwards in a curvilinear fashion between tragus and the crus of helix. It passes through the incisura terminalis and thus does not cut the cartilage. Both mastoid and external canal surgery can be done.

questions.question: A patient is undergoing a mastoidectomy procedure. During the procedure, a surgeon usesthe following instrument to explore the mastoid air cells. Name the given instrument567
questions.explanation: The above image is a MacEwen's curette and cell seeker. During mastoid surgeries, one end isused to explore the air cells and the other end is used to curette the intervening septa and575granulations.Note: MacEwan's (suprameatal) triangle is an important landmark to locate the mastoid antrumin mastoid surgery. It is bounded by-• Temporal line•The posterosuperior segment of the bony external auditory canal• The line drawn as a tangent to the external canal

questions.question: Which procedure is the following instrument not used in?RROMARROW
questions.explanation: The image shows Luc's forceps. It is not used in FESS.Luc's forceps is used in:-• Caldwell- Luc operation to remove mucosa• Submucosal resection- to remove bone or cartilage••• Polypectomy- to grasp and avulse polypsTo take a biopsy from the nose or throat

questions.question: The following instrument is:
questions.explanation: The image is of a Ballenger swivel knife. It is used in the removal of septal cartilage in SMR(Submucosal resection) operation.The blade of the knife revolves automatically and changes direction when cutting the cartilageanteroposteriorly downwards and posteroanteriorly. Different sizes of blades are present. It canbe used to harvest septal cartilage as a graft for reconstruction.Ballenger swivel knifeMARROOMARROW576

questions.question: A 35-year-old man with chronic sinusitis undergoes the following procedure to relieve him ofhis symptoms. Which of the following instruments is required to carry out this procedure?569

options.D: Tilley's antral burrOMARROWOpening of maxillarysinus in middle meatus-Middle turbinate-Inferior meatus- Cannula

questions.explanation: The procedure is proof puncture (antral lavage) which uses Tilley-Lichwitz trocar and cannula.They are used for the puncture of the lateral wall of the inferior meatus at a point 1.5-2.0cm fromthe anterior end of the inferior turbinate, near the attachment of concha with the lateral wall.Tilley-Lichtwiz trocar and cannula:Tilley Lichtwitz trocar and cannulaOMARROW

questions.question: Given below is an instrument used for irrigation. In which of the following procedures will itnot be used?
questions.explanation: The instrument is Rose's sinus douching cannula. It is used in irrigation of the maxillary sinus,which should already have a nasoantral window due to intranasal antrostomy or Caldwell Lucoperation. The direction of the tip is indicated by the hook outside.Note:Trephination (also known as trepanning or burr holing) is a surgical intervention where a hole isdrilled, incised or scraped into the skull using simple surgical tools. Trephination of frontal sinusis done for acute frontal sinusitis if there is persistence or exacerbation of pain or pyrexia in spiteof medical treatment for 48 h or if the lid swelling is increasing and threatening orbital cellulitis.

questions.question: A 20-year-old woman has complaints of reduced hearing on her right side. You perform adiagnostic test using the following instrument. What is the name of this instrument?000
questions.explanation: The image is of a Digital audiometer.An audiometer is an electronic device that produces pure tones, which can be increased ordecreased in 5 dB steps. The amount of intensity that has to be raised above the normal level is ameasure of the degree of hearing loss at that frequency. This is charted in the form of a graph577called an audiogram.The difference in the thresholds of air and bone conduction (A-B gap) is a measure of the degreeof conductive deafness.Uses:• To measure the threshold of hearing of air and bone conduction•Helps to predict speech reception threshold• To diagnose the type of hearing loss and measure the degree• For the prescription of hearing aids• Helps to find the degree of handicap for medicolegal purposes•A record can be kept for future reference.

questions.question: An objective diagnostic test is performed on a patient who complains of loss of hearing on hisright side. The following instrument is used to perform this test. What is this instrumentknown as?571
questions.explanation: The image is of a tympanometer. It is used in evaluating the status of the middle ear.It is based on a simple principle that when a sound strikes the tympanic membrane, some of thesound energy is absorbed while the rest is reflected. A stiffer tympanic membrane would reflectmore sound energy than a compliant one.By charting the compliance of the tympano-ossicular system against various pressure changes,different types of graphs called tympanograms are as follows:ComplianceType AType AsType ADType BType CTypes of tympanogramNormal tympanogram.Compliance is lower at or near ambient airpressure. Seen in fixation of ossicles,e.g. otosclerosis or malleus fixation.High compliance at or near ambient pressure.Seen in ossicular discontinuity or thin and laxtympanic membrane.A flat or dome-shaped graph. No change incompliance with pressure changes. Seen inmiddle ear fluid or thick tympanic membrane.Maximum compliance occurs with negativepressure in excess of 100 mm H20. Seen inretracted tympanic membrane.B-200CADAAs0+100+200-100OMARROW578
